channel.title: Array sorting help

item.title: Array sorting help
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

For multi-dimensional arrays, I believe you just take the “level” you want to sort.

For example, a 2D array would do something like

multiArray[0].sort()

And to sort all of them, you could just make a for loop (google traversing multi dimensional arrays)

Read full topic

item.title: Array sorting help
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

ok im trying to think of what would be the best way to do this. im using javascript b/c its on a webpage. ok i know about the arrayName.sort(sortFunction) i get that but that with a 1D array. im wanting to sort a multi-dimension array across a dimension.

simplified (note: example doesn’t follow syntax of javascript):

array[][][];

//sort the first dimension by the elements in index 0 of the 3rd dimension.

// b4 sorted
array = [[[1,3,4,5,6],[2]],[[1,2,3,4,5],[2]],[[2,4,5,6,7],[2]],[[2,3,4,5,6],[2]]]

// after sorted
array = [[[1,2,3,4,5],[2]],[[1,3,4,5,6],[2]],[[2,3,4,5,6],[2]],[[2,4,5,6,7],[2]]]

sorry if thats confusing that probably why im not thinking of a fix for this; making it more complex than i need.

Read full topic
